hook.text: In the 1950s, a 'safe' morning sickness pill caused over 10,000 babies to be born with severe limb deformities.

buildup.text: Thalidomide was marketed as completely safe and sold without prescription in 46 countries.

discovery.text: The drug crossed the placenta and interfered with fetal limb development during a critical growth window.

punchline.text: The worst drug disaster created the best safety rules.

quiz.question: What major change resulted from the thalidomide disaster?
options: Modern drug regulation requiring proof of safety before approval
A permanent global ban on all new medications
The elimination of all morning sickness treatments
